alert.note: Alert for Cascade County below 5000ft; Eastern Pondera and Eastern Teton; Gates of the Mountains; Little Belt and Highwood Mountains; Southern High Plains; Western and Central Chouteau County (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 08 at 5:25AM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Lewis and Clark, southeastern Pondera, southeastern Teton, west central Chouteau and northwestern Cascade Counties through 615 AM MDT... At 525 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles west of Dutton to 9 miles southwest of Cascade. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Great Falls, Cascade, Fairfield, Dutton, Black Eagle, Fort Shaw, The Knees, Fort Shaw, Power, Malmstrom Afb, Eden, Stockett, Tracy, Vaughn, First Peoples Buffalo Jump State Park, Sun River, Tower Rock State Park, Collins, Ulm, and Sand Coulee. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Cascade County below 5000ft; Eastern Pondera and Eastern Teton; Gates of the Mountains; Little Belt and Highwood Mountains; Southern High Plains; Western and Central Chouteau County
